name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: “Through circumstance, you are born in a place, and the history and the policies of that place will, for the majority of humanity, forever determine whether, to where, and for how long you can leave.”
https://t.co/YUq3s6N8gP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: These photos from 1918 are amazing https://t.co/rCXWezAhHZ https://t.co/Kur12EXVYZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: "What the Canadian example does show, however, is what the United States could have looked like if the U.S. effort had not been led by malicious, self-seeking incompetents." from @davidfrum  https://t.co/cte2hekrHz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: “There are tens of thousands of New Yorkers, and unfortunately it may be hundreds of thousands, who genuinely believe that their vote has been counted—for reasons that are absolutely appalling and egregious.” -@MrMikeBlake 
https://t.co/iLKHo7gWjK

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @kevinstownsend: On today's episode of @TheAtlantic's Social Distance podcast, we tried to explain the immune system. I feel like this moment gives a good summary: https://t.co/yf3g3CTrA7 https://t.co/qV88Mpptzd

name: TheAtlantic
text: On the latest episode of "The Ticket," Representative Donna Shalala tells @IsaacDovere that Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is "personally responsible for a number of unnecessary deaths." https://t.co/IG6CiQGwTQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Arizonans—especially those in the suburbs—are souring on Donald Trump. The state party is veering right anyway, reports @elainejgodfrey:
https://t.co/plWDxJL1x2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Work friendships are born of convenience and necessity—and the pandemic is showing which can survive without 40-hour-a-week proximity, Nicole Mo writes. If widespread remote work sticks around, these relationships will never be the same: https://t.co/OvYNL3UIGB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Welcome to the world of performative authoritarianism, a form of politics that reached new heights of sophistication in Russia over the past decade and has now arrived in the United States," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/65yukuttW4

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Though no one would ever wish it to happen this way,” @JamesHamblin writes, “the pandemic could mark a chance to reexamine how much cleanliness is good for us, and what practices we’d be better off without.” https://t.co/v42bnRjmlq

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to the daunting question of reopening schools, America’s educators deserve a plan, not a trap. Dave Grohl writes about the country’s responsibility to people like his mother, a former public-school teacher: https://t.co/zYC0KjlTdW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Many of the behaviors that our elected representatives display regularly on Capitol Hill would get them scolded at best and marched out by security at worst if they held the same kinds of jobs as most of their constituents," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/zlJWt6za4k
